content.title: Scheme For Campus Accommodation & Facilities Enhancing Social Experience
content.beneficiary: Students and researchers in Government/Government-aided engineering colleges/University departments/Polytechnics
content.details: The 'Scheme for Campus Accommodation & Facilities Enhancing Social Experience (CAFES)' was introduced by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Department of Higher Education (DoHE), to provide financial assistance for construction of hostel to create a congenial study atmosphere free from the shackles of domestic shores so as to encourage students to pursue their education career without dropping out.
benefits: Financial assistance for construction of hostel
Support for establishment of gym equipment
Support for establishment of indoor sports club
Support for establishment of library for preparation of tests for competitive examination/higher education
eligibility: AICTE approved Government/Government-aided engineering colleges/University departments/Polytechnics
Institute must be in existence for the last five years
CAFES (SC/ST students) – 200 SC/ST students on roll
CAFES (NER) – 60 students on a roll per year
CAFES (Differently abled students) - 150 Differently abled students
exclusions: Institutes located in Punjab, Haryana, Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland & UTs are not covered under CAFES – SC/ST students scheme
content.application_process: Offline application process through AICTE Web Portal using Institute's Login Credential.
documents_required: Enrollment figures as per official records
Two copies of the plan and detailed estimates signed by the Engineer/Architect and countersigned by the Principal
Certificate from the college indicating covered area and cost per sq. meter
Certificate from the competent authority regarding additional expenditure
Structural soundness certificate from a competent structural engineer

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of The 'CAFES' Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to facilitate continuation of education and interaction between students for their all-around development.

faqs.question: How Many Variants Are To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme has three variants addressing the needs of: (i) CAFES - SC/ST students (ii) CAFES – NER (Institute located in North Eastern Region) (iii) CAFES – Differently Abled students.

faqs.question: Does The Scheme Also Provide Support To Polytechnics?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme supports Government/Government-aided engineering colleges/University departments/Polytechnics.

faqs.question: Is There An Upper Ceiling To The Financial Assistance Of The Universities?
faqs.answer: Yes, the limit of Funding from AICTE is ₹ 3.25 crore.

faqs.question: What Amount Out Of The Total Fund Must Go For The Construction Of The Hostel?
What Amount Out Of The Total Fund Must Go For The Establishment Of Gym Equipment?
Are The Funds Disbursed In Installments Or As A Lump Sum?
faqs.answer: Funds are disbursed in installments based on project milestones.

faqs.question: What If The Institute Fails To Initiate The Construction Work Within Six Months?
faqs.answer: The amount is to be refunded to AICTE with accrued interest.
